attributes.action: Before triggering Article 50 an initial UK-EU deal must be handled by Vote Leave
attributes.background: Following the EU referendum, activation of Article 50 of the 2009 Lisbon Treaty should only take place once an initial agreement, outlining key areas of the future relationship, has been reached between the UK and EU. The negotiation should be led by prominent members of the Vote Leave campaign.

attributes.action: A second referendum if UK job losses exceed 12,000 after initiating Article 50.
attributes.background: The referendum campaigns were based on projections that were largely distrusted. A "pain threshold" of 12,000 job losses would be the equivalent of three "Port Talbot Steelworks", the latter creating considerable public out-cry when the potential 4000 job losses were announced in March 2016.
attributes.additional_details: If corporations announce expected job cuts that they will implement if the Article 50 process is initiated, then there will be some threshold over which the electorate and politicians on either side of the debate should be allowed to reconsider their referendum position. Announcements of UK job losses on Friday 24th June already include JP Morgan (4,000), HSBC and Morgan Stanley with the first already matching Port Talbot. A second referendum can help the United Kingdom avoid such job losses.

attributes.action: Set out principles for any negotiation pertaining to leaving the European Union
attributes.background: Parliament should vote on a motion supporting access to European markets, free movement of people, and compatibility with major areas of European law. This being a move to boost confidence for business and markets, and to reassure the European citizens living and working in the UK.
attributes.additional_details: There is currently great uncertainty and anxiety both for business and financial markets, and for the many Europeans who live and work as part of our communities; friends, colleagues and loved ones. Parliament should act to create certainty and confidence, setting out the principles on which any negotiation should be based. This should include the key areas such as free movement, access to markets, and legal compatibility such topics as data protection.

attributes.action: Debate security implications of the removal of U.K. border controls from Calais.
attributes.background: Politicians in France are calling on President Hollande to scrap immigration checks on the French side of the English Channel following UK's vote to leave the EU. We need to know what this means for the UK.

attributes.action: Referendum results less than 60-40 and 75% turnout should go to a second round.
attributes.background: The two most recent referendums (referenda) in the UK did not 'convincingly' reflect the opinion of the general public and did not prove their wishes beyond 'reasonable doubt'.

attributes.action: Legalise the use of hemp oil for medical purpose within the UK.
attributes.background: Scientific facts prove the benifit of this oil..
attributes.additional_details: Rick Simpson  cancer uk. Many other scientific studies.

attributes.action: Electoral vote of acceptance of any Prime minister not Elected
attributes.background: A lot of people vote for the public face of a political party are electing a Prime minister to lead the country, if a political party in Government has to choose a new leader whom will become Prime minister the electorate should have the right approve or reject that person.

attributes.action: Disband the office of the Prime Minister.
attributes.background: Since 1651 we the subjects United Kingdom and the commonwealth have only had a hand full of successful Prime  Ministers, I believe that we should empower our Monarchy with the full powers invested in a head of state

attributes.action: Amend the Human Rights Act to support informed public debate.
attributes.background: Only when we have a clear view of issues can we make informed choice, people cannot make functional choices when they do not know what they are choosing. It should be an offence for those in public office to provide misleading, inaccurate or untruthful information that obfuscates public debate.
attributes.additional_details: I propose an additional article under the UK Human Rights Act which prevents the dumbing down and obfuscation of public debate. It is the duty of public servants to bring clarity and accuracy to public debate to establish objectives and clean information both pro and con. It should be an offence for those in public office to provide misleading, inaccurate or untruthful information that obfuscates public debate.

attributes.action: Have better support for people with learning disabilities in schools
attributes.background: Aa someone who has learning disabilities I feel like I havent had enough support.

attributes.action: New EU referendum should Scotland leave the UK and break the Union.
attributes.background: This petition calls for a suspension of any action for an exit from the EU until the issue of Scottish independance is resolved. If Scotland leave and the UK breaks up then a new question would need to be posed, reflecting the nature of the change, the original question becoming invalid.
attributes.additional_details:
This petition aims for Parliament to consider and plan through any serious changes that may result from Scottish independance and the impact this would have on the recent referendum result and mindset of the voting public.

The original referendum question posed was for the United Kingdom exiting the EU, should Scotland gain independance then the UK breaks up and the question is void, given the change of circumstances.

attributes.action: Hold public inquiry into whether BBC bias led to EU referendum result
attributes.background: People trust the BBC and looked to them to inform on issues around the referendum. Pressure on the BBC by pro Brexit influences caused them to give equal weight to rational argument and hyperbole. The public could not discern and were undecided and voted emotionally. Did BBC bias cause Brexit?
attributes.additional_details: There was a concerted campaign by forces favouring Brexit to influence BBC coverage. Sites such as http://bbccomplaints.com/ and social media campaigns forced the BBC into a bias against rational argument and for perceived 'balance'. With an equal weight, and equal criticism, of both sides the voting public were left undecided. The BBC failed in it's mission to educate and inform and this caused the Brexit vote.

attributes.action: Allow the City and Greater London to join the EU
attributes.background: Given the EU referendum result showed a large discrepancy of opinion between those voting in London and those voting in England and Wales, we would like to initiate proceedings for the City and Greater London to join the EU.

attributes.action: A new referendum: Leave the EU now or in 2036 (subject to a further referendum)?
attributes.background: We have voted to leave the EU which is irreversible. We now need a referendum to ascertain whether we leave the EU now or in 20 years' time (subject to a further referendum, of course)?
attributes.additional_details: The EU is not perfect and will probably be subject to some kind of reform in the coming decades. This additional referendum is to find out if the UK population would like postpone our exit pending any changes that may occur within the union.

attributes.action: Provide a way to account for children's opinion on issues affecting their future
attributes.background: 14 million under 18s live in the UK and aren't able to vote. According to Unicef they have the right for their views to be heard and respected. When important debates are taking place, directly affecting their future, we propose that their opinions should be officially collated by Government.
attributes.additional_details:
.UN Convention on the Rights of the Child, Article 12 (respect for the views of the child) and Article 13 (freedom of expression).
.Improving the Spiritual, Moral, Social and Cultural (SMSC) development of pupils: Departmental advice for independent schools, academies and free schools (DfE November 2013, p5)
.Section 78 of the Education Act 2002
.UNICEF- Promoting Children's Participation in Democratic Decision Making (Gerison Lansdown, UNICEF Innocenti Research Centre, ISBN: 88-85401-73-2)

attributes.action: No more cuts for working age people. Remove ringfencing of pensioner benefits
attributes.background: Since the financial crisis and recession it's young and working age people who have born the brunt of budget cutbacks. Real wages have fallen 7% for working families and 16% for 18-24 year olds. Pensioners have seen a 4% increase in the incomes which is neither fair or sustainable going forward.
attributes.additional_details:
Whilst efforts to raise living standards in the elderly population is commendable, the disparity is now too great and ringfencing of pensioner benefits should be removed. This has become even more pressing in light out the EU referendum where the over 65 group voted strongly in favour of leaving the EU. Any negative economic effects of this decision should be shared across all who voted for it.

Figures quoted from Machin 2015

attributes.action: EU Referendum Rules to be made into Law that the first result stands.
attributes.background: To ensure fairplay in all referendums, the first and only vote is the one that must stand as the result. As a democratic society, any vote with a majority cannot be challenged just because some of the electorate are not happy at the result. There must be no TMO in this situation.
attributes.additional_details:
The EU referndum has been held and a majority of over 1 million voters chose the Leave option. A hardline minority of Remain campaingers have baulked at the result and are now tring to manipulate a democratic voting system by calling for a percentage ruling change. 

There is no actual evidence presented by parliament to support either option in the referendum as to the benefits or negatives of being a member of the EU. 

Any government leader that chose the remain option should now stand down.

attributes.action: Make smoking a criminal offence
attributes.background: Smoking is the biggest cause of premature deaths in the UK. Cigarette smoke contains around 4,000 chemicals, among which are over 50 known carcinogens. It is clear smoking needs to be stopped. By making smoking illegal it provides smokers with an incentive; quit or face charges.
attributes.additional_details: Smoking kills around 100,000 per year. Some of the cancers caused by smoking include lung, mouth, larynx, oesophagus and leukaemia to name just a few. Other problems can include heart disease, dementia, pulmonary fibrosis and gum disease. Smoking needs to be stopped right now. And if making it illegal is the only way, so be it. Sign now and create a healthier nation for the sake of a family member you might know who smokes. If smoking is made illegal, it could save the life of someone you know.

attributes.action: Form an emergency government made of leaders of each major political party
attributes.background:
This emergency government will be responsible for negotiating the exit from the EU.
Nominated leaders from each major political party will join together to negotiate so that every member of the public will be represented, and not just those who voted for a particular individual party.

attributes.action: Make Bristol an independent city state to rejoin the European Union.
attributes.background: The majority of Bristol voted to remain in the EU.  Lets make our vote count!

attributes.action: Hold a referendum on Greater London becoming an independent, EU member state
attributes.background: We want a referendum held in Greater London on becoming an independent, federal state, that will remain a member of the European Union. This reflects the wishes of the majority of Londoners to remain in the EU
attributes.additional_details: The referendum on the 23rd of June clearly showed a divide in the beliefs of Londoners and the majority of the rest of England. Continued membership of the EU is vital if London is to remain the biggest financial centre in Europe. In addition, leaving would clearly go against the wishes of the majority of Londoners. We also believe that a divorce from the UK would be less traumatic than a split from the 450 million strong EU population

attributes.action: People over the age of 70 should not be allowed to vote
attributes.background: With the latest Brexit it is clear to see this was due to the votes of the older generation and not the younger one. However it is young people's future and they can't vote. If there is a limit on young age, why not old age?

attributes.action: Make June 22nd a national holiday, in tribute to Jo Cox. Cox's Day
attributes.background: Request an annual holiday as a reminder of Jo Cox and inspirational work and influence on peace and human rights. Hate will never win #moreincommon

attributes.action: Change the law on Historic Sexual abuse and assault cases and penalties
attributes.background: If a historic sexual abuse/assault case is brought before a court, if the case occurred earlier than 2003 a person prosecuted of the crime has a penalty or prison sentence which refers to the law under that point in time. All historic cases should use the current sentencing for historic cases also
attributes.additional_details: The current cases means that someone who abused someone in 1970's or 1980's only allows a person to be prosecuted under the laws of that time undermining the sentencing of someone who may have committed abhorent crimes against people, this would allow a better and more efficient way to proscute historical sexual crimes.

attributes.action: All licenced bars and clubs should have a breathalyser to prevent drink driving
attributes.background: This petition is to ask the government to make all licenced bars and clubs which serve alcohol to have breathalysers at hand for patrons to use if in control of a vehicle. This would minimise the risks associated with driving over the drink drive limit and would inturn reduce drink drive fatalities.

attributes.action: Urge the US to ban assault rifles being available outside of the military
attributes.background: After recent shootings in America, I believe we need to stop military grade weaponry being available to people outside of the military. Did you know people on the terrorist watch list in American can buy assault rifles! This needs to stop. Let's not lose any people anymore.

attributes.action: Enforce all secondary schools to teach Drama, Art and Music at key stage three.
attributes.background:
The majority of jobs require creativity, and although you need natural talent, if these subjects are not taught, the youth will never have the freedom to think creatively and explore a world other than academia. 
Without creativity where will the next Branson, Ant & Dec, or Kelly Hoppen come from?

attributes.background: It is a disgrace that the UK has only 3 naval vessels to patrol over 7000 miles of coastline whilst countries like the Netherlands has 16 vessels and Italy has 600. Recent events have highlighted acts of gunrunning and people traffickers landing on remote beaches and marinas.

Most van drivers also drive a car so it can be confusing when there are no speed respeater signs for vans. Van technology has improved making them safer.

attributes.action: Care homes to be required by law to provide Mario Kart gaming for residents.
attributes.background: This petition was started by a medical student who recently attended an Elderly Medicine placement in Derbyshire. In many Local Authority owned care homes, residents would be sat passively in front of the lounge television screen. Residents may enjoy a competitive, interactive activity instead.
attributes.additional_details: "When groups of generally healthy medical patients aged 50 and over were instructed to play a video game that increased in difficulty and complexity with each new level, researchers at the University of Iowa found that they gained years of cognitive processing improvement after one year of play." Lynn, Kecia (2015). More Proof That Elderly People Should Play More Video Games. Big Think. http://bigthink.com/ideafeed/more-proof-that-elderly-people-should-play-more-video-games

attributes.background: In nurseries there is a ratio of 1 nursery nurse per 3 children depending on age. I want the same for the elderly. 1 carer for 4 clients needing care. 1 nurse for 5 clients. This obviously is just an estimate, it depends on other factors and should be looked into.

attributes.background: Animals should not be in captivity unless they are ill or can not survive in the wild. By replacing all of the well and healthy animals with sick or maltreated ones, we can provide a better quality of life for all animals. The healthy ones by releasing them back, and the sick by saving them.

attributes.action: Scrap the DBS system because most immigrants have no past record.
attributes.background: As a graduate in International Politics/Security I think its wrong for the British people to be penalised when looking for a job just because they have a conviction. When compared to the thousands of immigrants that arrive unlawfully in Britain with no prior record of their past.
attributes.additional_details: Please note, the barred list is a separate issue and is most definitely useful for protecting the vulnerable but just because someone has committed for example financial crime this does not mean that they would hurt someone. I believe this country will lose many of its citizens slowly but surely because one by one people will leave this and travel to where they feel more secure.

attributes.action: Allow dividends paid to a Sipp in drawdown to be withdrawn tax free up to limit.
attributes.background: Dividends from shares are now tax free up to £5,000 pa. As a Sipp holder, soon to be in drawdown, I have realised that dividends paid to the Sipp, then withdrawn by the pension holder, will be taxed at marginal rate. Pensioners should have the option to withdraw dividends up to £5,000 pa tax free.

attributes.action: Make childhood vaccinations a legal requirement for state-school education
attributes.background: Un-vaccinated children pose a potentially serious risk to the health of other children - particularly those for whom vaccines are less effective or who are medically unable to be vaccinated. Where the failure to vaccinate has no medical basis, other children should be protected.
attributes.additional_details:
Recent years have seen a rise in outbreaks of preventable diseases, which has been at least partially attributed to an increase in parents electing not to have their children vaccinated. These include smallpox (which had been all but eradicated by vaccination), and measles. 
Children are at particular risk, due to the way they play very closely together, and their less developed immune systems.
In Australia, it is already a requirement for receipt of state welfare.

attributes.action: Allow unrestricted work and residency visas for citizens of the commonwealth.
attributes.background: Commonwealth countries such as Canada, New Zealand and Australia have strong historical ties with our nation. Polls suggest all three countries are favourable to the idea, it would help alleviate concerns about mass immigration from countries with dissonant cultural values by offset.
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.theglobeandmail.com/news/national/canadians-support-visa-free-travel-between-some-countries-poll/article29204662/?service=mobile

There are multiple sources that support this, I firmley believe it would ease the discord in our society, also it would provide fantastic opportunities for our citizens to learn about the world and enrich our society. I know it would need to be mutual between these nations but I believe we can start a dialogue, also drop NHS surcharge for those nationals.

Our country is one of the few countries in the world that provides help and benifits to those who are struggling to get by, but what about the people that have fallen off that ladder? Well to climb back up as you need an address to apply for benifits.
attributes.additional_details: That is where you come in by sighning the petition you will be helping homeless people regain there stability while they apply for benifits. Therefore helping change hundreds of thouasands of people regain a home and get off the streets for ever!

attributes.action: Vote that the house has no confidence in the Prime Minister.
attributes.background: He's not fit to hold the office of Prime Minister because he has knowingly put the UK in a position which he believed will undermine the security of the UK, destabilise Europe and the world economy, diminish the capabilities of our intelligence services and will cause mass unemployment.
attributes.additional_details: He has without necessity called for a referendum which could result in the UKs exit from the EU believing it will be ruinous to the nation.  In numerous speeches made by himself and his ministers have made it abundantly clear that he considers a possible exit from the EU would be disastrous for the economic welfare and security of the nation. He's therefore been derelict in his duty to defend the nation against threat by setting in motion a chain of events he believes will harm the UK.

attributes.action: Start publishing summaries of protest messages written on voting papers
attributes.background: Writing a message on a ballot paper is seen by many as a legitimate means to protest or to air a view. Such messages are written as part of the democratic process with the intention of being read and therefore should be published after elections as a matter of course.

attributes.action: Move parliament to "Skegness". UK Parliament tour seaside resorts during refurb.
attributes.background: Due to 6 years of repairs to the Palace of Westminster,  parliament will be held in a different location. This petition asks the government to discuss touring seaside towns during the repairs. This would utilise our vast holiday park infrustucture, facilitate regenerration and showcase democracy.

attributes.action: Change E.S.A back to Incapacity benefit
attributes.background: I believe the current policies regarding ESA are wrong and unreasonable to the extent that the long term sick, are sick and not able to work, the decision to put the sick into work makes no sense as the illnesses are still there and there is no work for long term sufferers.

attributes.action: Close Pentonville Prison
attributes.background: This prison is failing both inmates and the general public, and needs to be closed immediately.
attributes.additional_details: http://www.independent.co.uk/news/uk/crime/two-prisoners-escape-pentonville-prison-north-london-ministry-justice-a7402701.html

attributes.action: Remove Prescription Charges for Long-Term Physical/Mental Health Conditions
attributes.background:
In England you pay for prescriptions, unless you have an illness from a special list, or meet other criteria (eg age or max income/assets). This list was set in the 60s; cancer is the only new addition.

We call for those with illnesses lasting 6+ months to get free prescriptions for that illness.
attributes.additional_details:
Around 800,000 people skimp on medication for cost reasons (IPSOS MORI). This raises overall NHS costs. E.g. the cost of an A&E visit for worse asthma exceeds the cost of the drugs. The regime is unfair & out of date, leaving many risking their health.

Further reading: 	
- Gilmore Report: https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/prescription-charges-review-the-gilmore-report
- https://www.asthma.org.uk/get-involved/campaigns/our-policy-work/prescription-charges
- http://bit.ly/prescharges

attributes.action: The mandatory installation of an automatic braking system in all lorries
attributes.background: Due to the recent tragic accidental killing of a family of four people by a lorry with a distracted driver, I petition that all lorries be fitted with an mandatory automatic braking system that would come into force if the driver were incapacitated or distracted.

attributes.action: Increase the Teacher Training Bursuries for Core subjects and Primary Education.
attributes.background: The teacher training bursury for Biology has been slashed by £5000 since last year and is unacceptable. Biology is a core subject and should be treated with the same respect as Chemistry and Physics. To take away from the bursury will only push teachers to leave and teach abroad.
attributes.additional_details: The teacher training bursury is given to students hoping to become either primary or secondary school teachers, it is used to help pay their course fees of £9000 and their living expenses for the year as they do not recieve pay even though they will be working full time. Subjects that require specialism recieve a larger bursury. Biology is not an easy subject and is a core subject throughout young people's time In education and should be given the same bursury as chemistry and physics.

attributes.action: Enshrine the UKRI's long-term mission and Haldane principle in Royal Charter
attributes.background: The Higher Education and Research Bill 2016 will dissolve UK Research Councils' Royal Charters and form a super-council, UK Research & Innovation (UKRI), to act strategically across disciplines. The UKRI must aim to fund research for the UK's long-term good, at arm's length from day-to-day politics.
attributes.additional_details: Higher Education and Research Bill 2016 [Bill No 004 of 2016-17]
